channel.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out
channel.description:
I've been working on a (PI) project and I'm trying to finally swap it out with my old (PI) project that is being hosted. The issue I'm having is I cannot for the life of me find where to edit my servers' ip address from localhost (0.0.0.0) to my no-ip. [u][i]Server side not client [/i][/u]
[i][b] I always have problems with the easy things X.x [/b][/i]

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

That is just text drawn from the server class saying the server is ready and online. You don’t have to change anything server sided to make the server online.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out
item.dc:creator: @HandgunSally HandgunSally
item.description:
@HandgunSally wrote:

[quote=“Lil wayne fan, post:4, topic:437418”][quote author=HandgunSally link=topic=540129.msg3954957#msg3954957 date=1332655200]

Uhm, client sided, client.java serch “server =”

Thanks for reply, looking for server side not client
[/quote]
If your trying to make your server public, you change it in the client side, not the server side.[/quote]

Im running my server on a different serverCPU, It is port forwarded and has no errors it says listening to 0.0.0.0:5555 im also running my old rsps (PI) there but i shut it off when trying to connect to the new pi., My client is on myCPU with the ip changed to my no-ip. when i log-in it says error connecting to server, but if i run the source on myCPU the client will connect to it even though its edited to connect to my serverCPU

My old (pi) source is running and working and is #36 on moparscape’s server list at 100% uptime

Read full topic
item.source: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out

item.title: Need help! easy question but i just cant figure it out
item.dc:creator: @Lil_wayne_fan Lil wayne fan
item.description:
@Lil_wayne_fan wrote:

[quote=“HandgunSally, post:3, topic:437418”][quote author=Lil wayne fan link=topic=540129.msg3954954#msg3954954 date=1332654891]
Uhm, client sided, client.java serch “server =”
[/quote]

Thanks for reply, looking for server side not client :D[/quote]
If your trying to make your server public, you change it in the client side, not the server side.

Read full topic
